txt.en: Book 3, Chapter 1: Meneldir's Kin
Reveal hidden spies nearby, and defeat them ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'We can stay on the Greenway for another day's travel before we reach the ruins at which Narndir makes his camp. Our warning that Saruman has betrayed the good folk of Middle-earth must reach the chieftain of the Dúnedain, and Narndir will know where he can be found. It will not be a pleasing reunion for me... but it must be done.\n\n'The road leaves Herne from the eastern side but circles the town to the north, and that is the way we should go.'
'DNT - Blah!'
Search the surrounding area with Meneldir

'I feel eyes upon us, [placeholder]. Someone watches us, and I am put in mind of what Egfrith wrote: that she tracked Boromir for many days as he journeyed across the empty lands.

'No, I do not think she has returned to plague our steps; she was intent on reaching Saruman with what she learned of Boromir when she left us. But this might be another spy.

'See what you can find nearby, my friend. Perhaps some clue will identify this unseen watcher for us.'
'Do you sense that? I feel eyes watching us.'
Learn what Meneldir has discovered
'DNT - Blah!'
Talk to Meneldir by the body
'Are these feathery spies or only carrion birds?'
Meneldir stops and looks around, worry creasing his brow
Meneldir is ready to continue his journey to find the Dúnedain in Bree-land.
DNT - Blah!

'No... no! What cruel jest is this?'

Meneldir stares in horror at the body of a Ranger lying in the grass.

'This is the man we seek, [placeholder]. This is Narndir.'
What has Meneldir discovered?
DNT - Blah!
The body of a Ranger lies in the brush.
Meneldir has come to a halt on the Greenway.
Meneldir has asked you to continue northward along the Greenway in the direction of Bree-land.
Meneldir told you he felt eyes upon the two of you. Spies?
Travel north along the Greenway in the direction of Bree-land
Talk to Meneldir on the Greenway
What has Meneldir discovered?
Defeated hidden spies ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Furious squawking signals the arrival of feathery spies!

'Our warning that Saruman has betrayed the good folk of Middle-earth must reach the chieftain of the Dúnedain, and Narndir will know where he can be found. It will not be a pleasing reunion for me... but it must be done.\n\n'The road leaves Herne from the eastern side but circles the town to the north, and that is the way we should go.'
'See what you can find nearby, my friend. Perhaps some clue will identify this unseen watcher for us.'
Meneldir suddenly gives a shout, and races to the north-west
A body lies here in the brush
